messages: d711e4c8dbc8ccb10d953ab45ad18a36 (09:37): +tpope: which plugin?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:37): +for ruby on rails
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:38): +it's on vim.org or http://svn.tpope.net/rails/vim/railsvim
d711e4c8dbc8ccb10d953ab45ad18a36 (09:40): +does it support omnicompletion?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:40): +not apart from the standard ruby stuff
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:40): +actually I set up something for ^X^U but it's pretty simple

578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (09:41): +ACTION works on converting baycomb.vim to work like spectro, using HSL rather than rgb, using its functions, and pulling in the conversion functions from another colorscheme to make it work under 88/256 color terms
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:47): +phrakture: let g:rubycomplete_rails=1
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:47): +included with vim
84f028eecceb3f63a0b4855ff04b5c95 (09:50): +sqweek: thanks
d711e4c8dbc8ccb10d953ab45ad18a36 (09:52): +tpope: I don't know ruby, but I debated attempting a ruby omnicompletion plugin
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:53): +one made it into the final version
d711e4c8dbc8ccb10d953ab45ad18a36 (09:53): +yeah that one's not fabulous... I've emailed back and forth with that guy
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:53): +:e newfile.rb<CR>iFile.ex<C-X><C-O>
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:53): +yeah I don't find it particularly useful
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:53): +more of a novelty than anything
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:56): +I'm not really sure how you'd do better for such a dynamic language like ruby anyways
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:56): +other than maybe eliminating those sporadic but obnoxious errors
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (09:56): +that might be helpful
d711e4c8dbc8ccb10d953ab45ad18a36 (09:57): +the python one works well - can't deduce return types though (yet!)
d0ea6a3574acaa4d71f39ca1d8fd6b2e (09:57): +i have a little bit of code that crashes vim hard when i do omnicomplete via ruby
d0ea6a3574acaa4d71f39ca1d8fd6b2e (09:58): +but, if I've used autocomplete with other IDEs for ruby and vim's is the best so far
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:01): +the ruby indent plugin could use some work too
b4d146619f85d3fc03ca62ee766e62ba (10:01): +WebDragon|away: hola :)
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:10): +are vim numbers integers only, not float?

d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:11): +the new version of vim in debian (7.0.17) appears to have some broken form of brace-matching that involves highlighting and which cannot be disabled.  how does one fix this?
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:11): +kergoth: v:version? yes. actual version number? no
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:12): +tpope, i'm not talking about the version
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:12): +i'm talking about vim's number type in its scripts
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:12): +evilgeek, broken? works just fine here.  regardless, :help matchparen
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:12): +evilgeek: :help match-parens
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:13): +kergoth: looks like it. . just concatenates like they were strings
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:13): +that appears to tell me how to make this happen.  how does one *stop* it, though?
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:14): +au VimEnter * NoMatchParen   in your .vimrc works for me, evilgeek
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:14): +or :set matchpairs= I would imagine
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:14): +how is it broken?  set syntax=cpp and type in the string '{{/*}*/}}' and move your cursor around.
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:15): +evilgeek, read the help again, and continue to do so until it sinks in
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:16): +that example is true but also contrived
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:16): +the only time I find it to be a problem is with smilies in emails
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:16): +i believe we are looking at different files.  the help i see has a huge chunk of code that does not contain "NoMatchParens".
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:17): +<kergoth> evilgeek, broken? works just fine here.  regardless, :help matchparen
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:17): +line 20 in the file :help matchparen takes you to
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:17): +we are, indeed.  i was looking at match-parens.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:17): +I'm sorry your fish died :(.  I hope you flushed it :).
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:19): +this appears to cause vim 6.3 to complain upon startup that NoMatchParen is not a valid editor command.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:20): +if exists(":NoMatchParen")
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:20): +But I didn't think that functionality showed up until 7.0 anyway
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:20): +you sure are whiny for wanting help
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:20): +you may have to embed that in the actual autocmd
578bc83066ad6531ad1e883bf0e9e5bb (10:20): +oh noes,i used a vim 7.0 option under 6.3 and it tells me it isnt valid! *gasp*
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:21): +it was a rather odd thing to enable by default
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:21): +given that not even matchit gets that status
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:21): +It's damned fugly, IMHO.

7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:23): +tpope, how do you do the if exists() bit?  I did move a 7.0 .vimrc to a machine that had < 7.0, and got the error.  I solved it, of course, be deleteing the line.  But the if exists() would seem to be a better solution.
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:23): +tpope: i am unfamiliar with vim's command syntax, and my guess of au VimEnter * if exists(":NoMatchParen") NoMatchParen is evidently a syntax error.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:23): +au VimEnter * if exists(":NoMatchParen") | NoMatchParen | endif
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:24): +".vimrc" [converted] 130L, 4389C
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:24): +Error detected while processing VimEnter Auto commands for "*":
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:24): +E488: Trailing characters:  NoMatchParen | endif
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:24): +Press ENTER or type command to continue
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:24): +that also elicits a complaint
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:25): +That's your line, verbatim, in my vimrc
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:25): +grrr, let me look, you big babies
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:26): +tpope: sorry, but i seriously don't know vim's syntax.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:28): +fucking NoMatchParen doesn't take a |
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:28): +but we can work around it
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:29): +here is a much simpler solution
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:29): +let g:loaded_matchparen=1
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:29): +then you'll never see it again

7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:30): +I have that commented out in my .vimrc.  Someone in this channel told me that was "the wrong way to do it", and suggested the 'au ...'.  Now, I'm not adverse to using whatever way works, but why is one way more better than the other?
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:30): +that complains "E121: Undefined variable: g"
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:31): +make sure you used a : not a ;
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:31): +you can leave out the g: ... sometimes
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:31): +thanks.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:31): +if you never want to use it, that's an acceptable way, k4jcw
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:32): +I guess by the othe suggestion, the 'au...' it's only soft disabled.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:32): +if you want to do it the autocmd way, you'll need to define a function
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:32): +to me, the autocmd is the wrong way
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:32): +that's turning it off constantly
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:33): +rather than just disabling it to begin with
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:34): +if exists("+matchpairs") | set matchpairs= | endif
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:34): +that's yet another way
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:34): +and you could change the highlighting to something more subtle, or perhaps even invisible
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:35): +While I find the match highlighting annoying, I really like the mismatched pairs highlighting.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:35): +that's usually syntax specific
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:35): +and thus unaffected
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:35): +Yah.  I'm just saying I like it.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:36): +I wish it could tell me when I had too few!

7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:36): +I also like the code reformatting.  I won't say it gets confused with switch() statements and indenting, but the results are not always what I want.  Although that case rarely happens enough for it to be a problem.
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:37): +yeah I don't like a lot of the switch stuff
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:37): +in many languages
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:37): +few get it like I like
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:38): +it says right in the help to use :let loaded_matchparen = 1
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:38): +whoever said it was "the wrong way" needs to eat more fiber
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:39): +OK, time to reboot and see if these 1394 drivers are going to finally work with this video camera or not.
7bad1199d55396b2b3563258f99132e7 (10:39): +Thanks for your help.
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:45): +what code reformatting does vim do itself?
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:45): +(are you talking about cindent or something similar?)
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:46): +filetype plugin indent on
0792377b948579515cfdf726e83cbc23 (10:46): +enjoy all the magic
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:52): +it seems to have problems with backslash-newline in C/C++.  neat, though.
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (10:54): +oh well.  vim doesn't quite seem to understand backslash-newline in general.
1daa50d99d4a4def0ba7f7c22ffb4f2f (11:00): +?
1daa50d99d4a4def0ba7f7c22ffb4f2f (11:00): +\n?
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (11:01): +Eclipser: \\\n, if you will.
1daa50d99d4a4def0ba7f7c22ffb4f2f (11:01): +aha
d2c121b6e9c82bb3c37f1dcf37a7687a (11:01): +Eclipser: it indicates that the line break is to be ignored.
1daa50d99d4a4def0ba7f7c22ffb4f2f (11:02): +yes I know :p
